page.title: 03THE CASTLE
page.content: The castle was built in 1092 and was last inhabited in 1450. It had a moat around it filled by water from the stream at Llangenny Lane. The water then run from the castle moat to the River Usk. As the castle fell into ruins the local people used the stones for their houses and all the house-fronts in the main street were built with these stones. 40 years ago children could enter the {dungeons}which are situated under the {"tump"}from an entry at the bottom of the square tower. This has since been filled in to prevent any accidents. The "tump",which is the local name for the raised portion of the castle, is now overgrown with weeds and if nobody cares for the castle soon it may well disappear. It was given to the town by a man in memory of his son who was killed in the First World War.
